maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Application
The New-ISApplication function creates a new Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Application. This is the base class used by ManagedDTS.
You cannot pipe objects to New-ISApplication
New-ISApplication returns a Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Application object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new IS Application object and assigns output to $app variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Copies an SSIS item from one SQL Server to another.
The Copy-ISItemSQLToSQL function copies SSIS item from one SQL Server to another. The item can be an SSIS folder or package. Recursive copies are supported.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the top level folder of items to copy.
Specifies the server name of the items to copy.
Specifies the destination folder of the items to copy. The top level folder of the destination server must be included.
Specifies the desintation server of the items to copy.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Allows the function to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an item.
Specifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the top level folder of items to copy.
Specifies the server name of the items to copy.
Specifies the destination folder of the items to copy. The top level folder of the destination server must be included.
Specifies the desintation server of the items to copy.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Allows the function to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an item.
Specifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
You cannot pipe objects to Copy-ISItemSQLToSQL.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Recursively copies all SSIS packages and folders from the Integration Server Z002 folder sqlpsx to Z002 sqlpsx2. In addition changes the Connection Manager named SSISCONFIG data source to .\SQL2K8 during the copy process

maml:description.maml:para: Copies an SSIS item from SQL Server to File System.
The Copy-ISItemSQLToFile function copies SSIS item from SQL Server to File System. The item can be an SSIS folder or package. Recursive copies are supported.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the top level folder of items to copy.
Specifies the server name of the items to copy.
Specifies the destination file system folder of the items to copy.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Allows the function to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an item.
Specifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the top level folder of items to copy.
Specifies the server name of the items to copy.
Specifies the destination file system folder of the items to copy.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Allows the function to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an item.
Specifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
You cannot pipe objects to Copy-ISItemSQLToFile.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Recursively copies all SSIS packages and folders from the Integration Server Z002 folder sqlpsx to the file system path C:\Users\u00\SSIS. In addition changes the Connection Manager named SSISCONFIG data source to .\SQLExpress during the copy process

maml:description.maml:para: Copies an SSIS item from File System to SQL Server.
The Copy-ISItemFileToSQL function copies SSIS item from File System to SQL Server. The item can be a File System folder or package. Recursive copies are supported.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the destination SSIS folder of the items to copy. The top level folder of the destination server must be included.
Specifies the desintation server of the items to copy.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Allows the function to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an item.
pecifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the destination SSIS folder of the items to copy. The top level folder of the destination server must be included.
Specifies the desintation server of the items to copy.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Allows the function to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an item.
pecifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
You cannot pipe objects to Copy-ISItemFileToSQL.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command copies all SSIS packages and folders from the File System pathC:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\100\DTS\Packages to Integration Server Z002 folder sqlpsx. In addition changes the Connection Manager named SSISCONFIG data source to .\SQLEXPRESS during the copy process

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the item at the specified location.

The Get-ISItem function gets the item at the specified location. It does not get the contents of the item at the location unless you use a wildcard character (*) to request all the contents of the item.
Specifies the path to an item. Get-ISItem gets the item at the specified location. Wildcards are permitted. This parameter is required, but the parameter name ("Path") is optional.
Specifies the top level SSIS folder.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
Specifies the path to an item. Get-ISItem gets the item at the specified location. Wildcards are permitted. This parameter is required, but the parameter name ("Path") is optional.
Specifies the top level SSIS folder.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies a recursive copy.
Specifies only those items upon which the cmdlet will act, excluding all others.
Omits the specified items. Wildcards are permitted.
You cannot pipe objects to Get-ISItem.
Get-ISItem returns a Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.PackageInfo object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command recursively gets all of the SSIS packages and folders starting at the root ('\') level on SQL Server Z002\SQL2K8.

maml:description.maml:para: Determines whether all elements of a path exist.

The Test-ISPath function determines whether all elements of the path exist. It returns TRUE ($true) if all elements exist and FALSE ($false) if any are missing. It can also tell whether the path syntax is valid and whether the path leads to a container or a terminal (leaf) element.
Specifies a path to be tested. This parameter is required, but the parameter name ("Path") is optional.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the path type. Valid values are folder, package or any.
Specifies a path to be tested. This parameter is required, but the parameter name ("Path") is optional.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the path type. Valid values are folder, package or any.
You cannot pipe objects to Test-ISPath.
Test-ISPath returns a Boolean representing whether the specified path exists.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the path msdb\sqlpsx exists on the SSIS server Z002.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new item.
The New-ISItem function creates a new item and sets its value. Only new SSIS folders are supported.
Specifies the path to the location of the new item
Specifies the value of the new item.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the path to the location of the new item
Specifies the value of the new item.
Specifies the server name.
You cannot pipe objects to New-ISItem.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new SSIS folder on the SSIS server Z002 under the root msdb path.

maml:description.maml:para: Renames an SSIS folder.
The Rename-ISItem function changes the name of a specified item. Only SSIS folder names are supported.
Specifies the path to the item to rename.
Specifies the old name of the item.
Specifies the new name of the item.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the path to the item to rename.
Specifies the old name of the item.
Specifies the new name of the item.
Specifies the server name.
You cannot pipe objects to New-ISItem.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command renames the SSIS folder sqlpsx to sqlpsx on the SSIS server Z002. Only renaming of SSIS folders is supported by the rename-isitem function.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the SSIS package at the specified location.
The Get-ISPackage function gets the SSIS package at the specified location. Both SQL Server and File System stored packages are supported.
Specifies the path to the item to get
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the path to the item to get.
Specifies the server name.
You cannot pipe objects to Get-ISPackage.
Get-ISPackage returns a Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Package object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the package sqlpsx1.dtsx from the file systems and assigns it to the variable $package.
This command gets the package sqlpsx2 from the SSIS server Z002 and assigns it to the variable $package.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes the specified items.
The Remove-ISItem function deletes one or more items. Both packages and SSIS folders are supported.
Specifies a Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.PackageInfo collection with additional properties as returned from Get-ISItem.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
Specifies a Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.PackageInfo collection with additional properties as returned from Get-ISItem.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
You can pipe pInfo PackageInfo to Remove-ISItem.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command first gets items stored on the root path of the SSIS server Z002\SQL2K8 where the name matches sqlpsx and then removes the items. Both packages and folders that match the criteria will be removed from the SSIS server.

maml:description.maml:para: Writes or replaces the SSIS package with a new package.
The Set-ISPackage function writes or replaces the SSIS package with a new package. Both SQL Server and File System storage are supported.
Specifies an SSIS package.
Specifies the path of the new or replaced package. Both SQL Server SSIS and File System storage are supported.
Specifies the server name.
Allows the function to set packages that cannot otherwise be changed, such as replacing over a package.
Specifies an SSIS package.
Specifies the path of the new or replaced package. Both SQL Server SSIS and File System storage are supported.
Specifies the server name.
Allows the function to set packages that cannot otherwise be changed, such as replacing over a package.
You cannot pipe objects to Set-ISPackage.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets teh SSIS package sqlpsx2 from the SSIS server Z003 and saves the package to the SSIS server Z002.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the currently running packages on a SSIS server.
The Get-ISRunningPackage function gets the currently running packages on the specified SSIS server.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the server name.
You cannot pipe objects to Get-ISRunningPackage.
Get-ISRunningPackage returns a Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.RunningPackage object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a list of the currently running packages on SSIS server Z002.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Connection Manager data source to the specified SQL Server.
The Set-ISConnectionString function sets the Connection Manager data source to the specified SQL Server.
Specifies an SSIS package.
Specifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
Specifies an SSIS package.
Specifies a server name to change for the Connection Manager.
You cannot pipe objects to Set-ISConnectionString.
This function does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the SSIS package sqlpsx and sets the data source to '.\SQL2K8' for the Connection Manager SSISCONFIG.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets data from a SQL Server.
The Get-ISData function gets data a SQL Server.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the database name.
Specifies the query to execute.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the database name.
Specifies the query to execute.
You cannot pipe objects to Get-ISData.
Get-ISData returns a System.Data.DataRow object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command executes a SQL query against the pubs database on the Z002\SQL2K8 server and returns the authors table.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the SSIS configuration items.
The Get-ISSqlConfigurationItem function gets the SSIS configuration items using a SQL Server table store.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the database name.
Specifies the configuration table name.
Specifies the configuration filter.
Specifies the package path.
Specifies the server name.
Specifies the database name.
Specifies the configuration table name.
Specifies the configuration filter.
Specifies the package path.
You cannot pipe objects to Get-ISSqlConfigurationItem.
Get-ISSqlConfigurationItem returns a System.Data.DataRow object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the configuration item sqlpsx_ssis from the table [SSIS Configurations] from the database ssisconfig on the SQL Server Z002\SQL2K8. Only rows matching the \Package.Connections[Destination].Properties[ConnectionString] are returned.
